BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.history.com/topics/us-presidents/abraham-lincoln
ENDCONTEXT
Abraham Lincoln, the 16th President of the United States, was known for his role in preserving the Union during the Civil War and initiating the emancipation of slaves. He was born on February 12, 1809, in a one-room log cabin in Kentucky. Lincoln is also remembered for delivering the Gettysburg Address in 1863, which has become one of the most iconic speeches in American history. 

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
What significant roles did Abraham Lincoln play during his presidency?
Cite your source.
ENDINSTRUCTION

Abraham Lincoln, serving as the 16th President of the United States, played several significant roles during his presidency. He is best known for his leadership in preserving the Union during the American Civil War and for initiating the emancipation of slaves. Additionally, Lincoln delivered the Gettysburg Address in 1863, which is considered one of the most iconic speeches in American history.

**Source:** [History.com - Abraham Lincoln](https://www.history.com/topics/us-presidents/abraham-lincoln)
